body.p:
Head Qrs Simmonds Battery
Camp Toland Charleston West, V,a
February 6" 1864.
To His Excellency the Govner of Kentucky
Sir

Aggreeable to instructions form the Adjt Genl of Kentucky Dated Nov 23" 1863 to Send Muster Rolls of Simmonds Indp Vol Battery U, S, A, that the Officers might be commissioned", -- I have the honor to State that the Rolls were forwarded about the first of January 1864. Since which time we have not heard from them, or the Adjt Genl

As the Officers are very anxious to See the Commissions, if coming from Kentucky, I would respectfully urge an acknowledgment of the Rolls, and the command, or these will be an effort made to transfer the command to Ohio, the Govner is willing to fill up its ranks, Commission its officers, and acknowlege the Battery as one of its Veteran Batteries

Hoping Soon to hear your pleasure
I have the honor to remain
Very Respectfully
Your Obdt Servt
D, W, Glassie
Lieut Comdg Battery

Hd Qrs Simmonds Battery
Camp Toland
Charleston Westn Va
Feby 6" 1864
ans
Glassie D. W
Lt Comd Battery.
Says that in accordance with instructions from the Adj Genl, he forwarded the Muster Roll of Simmond's Battery. about the 1s Jany 1864 since which time he has not heard of the roll, nor from the Adj Genl States the officers are anxious to see their commissions, and urges an acknowledgement of the roll and command, or there will be an effort made to have the Battery transfered to Ohio. as a veteran Battery.
Ans. that rolls -- and coms were sent -- give the date
Boyle
Recd A. G. O. 12" Feby 1864
